description:
“Connecting People and Cultures around the Globe”

The vision of People to People International is that a network of culturally knowledgeable global citizens will be an active force in creating and sustaining a more peaceful world.

Believing that it is through connecting people across borders and cultures that we build the relationships that create understanding, the mission of People to People International is to offer multinational experiences that foster cross cultural learning, develop global leadership skills, and connect with an international network of people committed to making a positive difference in the world.

Because in an increasingly interconnected world, success in making a positive difference will come to those best prepared to work and lead across borders and divides, People to People International provides innovative ways for people to experience, learn, lead, and connect.

Chalks Corriette

President - PTPI Europe

chalks@ptpi.be

www.ptpi.be
name: People To People International (Europe) asbl

description:
Le but de ce groupe est de se faire connaissance en parlant français. Chaque mois on fera des activités ensemble – tous les membres peuvent proposer des évènements.

Tout le monde est le bienvenu, des débutants aux francophones. En principe, toutes les conversations seront en français. Pour ceux qui n’ont pas encore un bon niveau, ne vous inquiétez pas : le plus important, c’est d’essayer. La meilleure façon d’améliorer dans une langue est de la pratiquer!

Au plaisir de vous voir :)

The purpose of this group is to get to know one another while speaking French. Every month, we will do activities together – all group members are free to suggest events.

Everyone is welcome in the group, from beginners to French native speakers. In principle, all our conversations will be in French. For those who do not have a good level of French yet, don’t worry: the most important thing is to try. After all, the best way to improve in a language is to practise it!

Looking forward to seeing you :)

.

description:
Why NLP?

If you're looking for a community of people who are interested in exploring personal development then you've come to the right place!

We provide an opportunity to learn about and practice NLP, and share your learnings, discoveries and questions about NLP and its application in daily life. You don't need any NLP knowledge to join this Meetup group and you're also welcome if you've studied NLP already because you can contribute your existing skills and expertise to this community.

NLP (Neuro Linguistic Programming) is the study of subjective experience. Therefore, its the study of what makes us tick. It enables you to

  • Run your brain for peak performance
  • Learn, change and communicate more effectively
  • Teach & coach others to do the same

NLP is a powerful technology that when used ecologically can literally enable you to transform your life: you can get more freedom, balance and choice. You can have more fun!

Not only do you begin to create more of what you want in your life, you also have the tools to enable others to do the same. It forms the bedrock of powerful coaching.

We believe everyone should know this stuff!

You will be more content, have fantastic relationships and the planet will be a better place as a result.

NLP also puts the 'How' into popular fads such as "The Law of Attraction"and "Emotional Intelligence".

What is NLP-in-Brussels?

This group is for anyone interested in their personal development, discovering more about NLP (NeuroLinguistic Programming) and eventually training to become an NLP Practitioner, Master Practitioner or Coach.

Throughout the year we offer a wide range of taster seminars so you can get easy, first hand experience of NLP. As the purpose of this group is to bring people with common interests together, sharing and socialising is an integral part of all our Meetups.

You can also eventually do the full range of Practitioner and Master Practitioner certifications in NLP, TimeLine Therapy, Hypnotherapy and NLP Coaching. These are offered through our sponsors, are all done by native English speakers and provide a cost-effective alternative to having to go to an English-speaking country to complete these trainings.

In addition, our sponsors offer applied NLP courses, such as how to use NLP in Leadership, Change Management, Team Building, Presentations/Public Speaking, Negotiations & Selling, etc...

For anyone struggling with persistent personal problems you can also learn about Breakthrough Coaching - the first and only group in Belgium to offer this possibility.

Our speakers, trainers and coaches are skilled in Classic, New Code and 3rd Generation Systemic NLP having trained with both of the creators of NLP (John Grinder & Richard Bandler) and with many of the other leading developers in the field. So, you know that you'll be learning from some of the best...

Founder, Gerry Murray, is the Association for NLP's (ANLP) Ambassador in Belgium. The ANLP is the only independent NLP body in the world and its mission is: "To collectively make a positive difference to society by promoting the positive benefits of NLP and encouraging Individuals and Training Organisations to deliver their NLP in a professional, responsible and congruent way."

How does NLP-in-Brussels work?

Monthly taster seminars on core and applied NLP topics followed by a social activity (drinks/dinner). Please review the Upcoming and Past Meetups lists for examples of past Meetups and future events.

You need no prior NLP knowledge to attend most events.

We provide a place to learn and practice NLP and share your learnings, discoveries and questions about NLP and its application in daily life. This group is open to all levels: beginners, practitioners, master practitioners, therapists, coaches & trainers.

As the number of Practitioner members continues to grow, we now offer a few Practice Group seminars throughout the year and these are only open to certified NLP Practitioners and above. These seminars are clearly marked and provide an opportunity for Practitioners who have trained with different NLP schools to share, learn and practice together.

What if you want to qualify as an NLP Practitioner?

NLP is a practitioner discipline and therefore it needs to be practiced. You can think of it as an apprenticeship and you cannot learn it from a book!

Our sponsor, Wide Circle, offers a 7-Day accelerated NLP Practitioner Program for busy people who don't have 12-15 days to spend in a training room. These are internationally accredited courses. For more information please call: +32 476 417 606

Food for thought...

"NLP succeeds where traditional training fails to deliver because it works at a much deeper level of values, beliefs and identity and offers a myriad of tools and techniques for fast and effective change. NLP was not created for academic study or intellectual analysis. To know NLP is to short change yourself if you are not skilled enough to use it. To talk about NLP is still missing the point – you can only discover its power by trying it out. So the next time you catch yourself talking about NLP, stop. Practise what it is you are talking about and see how this changes your experience. That’s what NLP was designed for – to give you choice and control over your life experiences – to be at cause rather than effect." ~ David Molden, Best-selling NLP Author and Trainer

In effect, in every day use, learning has come to be synonymous with "taking in information". "Yes, I learned all about that at the training yesterday". Yet, taking in information is only distantly related to real learning. It would be nonsensical to say: "I just read a great book about bicycle riding - I've now learned that". ~ Peter Senge, The Fifth Discipline
name: NLP in Brussels

description:
This is a practice and learning group for anyone in and around Belgium who is interested in NLP.  Whether you are new to NLP, or have already some practice or certification, there is always potential for learning new things that really interest you, sharpening your skills, or just practice what you have already learned.

This is what dr. Richard Bandler, one of the 2 co-developers of NLP, writes about our trainer:

“I highly recommend Marc Innegraeve.  He is continually updating his training with the most up-to-date skills I have developed and one of those licensed internationally through the Society of Neuro-Linguistic Programming™.”
name: NLP in Belgium

description:
The Culti Meetup Group Belgium exists for the sole purpose of casual get-togethers in a friendly environment where every one feels welcome. The Meetups are all about meeting people in a laid back and social atmosphere. In this group Brussels is a Dutch/French bilingual city, more than anything else :).

Dutch is the majority language of Belgium, the national language of Flanders and.... The most authentic language of Brussels! German is the native language in the East of Belgium. And French...Is the majority language of Brussels and the South of Belgium... Therefor all of these language get treated as a local language in this Group :).

One of the 4 most common meetups in this group is practicing German together on nice meetups in easy to find venues. The other most common Meetups are the New in Town Meetup. On these meetups, English is the main language. Plus we also meet once in a while to practice Dutch and we also once in a while we meet to practice French.

Next to the New in Town, Dutch Language Meetups and German Language Meetups in Brussels, we will meet in other Belgium cities once in a while. And, last but not least: from time to time we will leave our towns for daytrips and weekendtrips to GREAT locations in several European countries!

So don't hesitate - and join us right now!

BTW Culti Group is active in Barcelona, Belgium, Berlin, Hamburg, Hessen, The Netherlands and NRW. Each chapter has it's own dynamics!
name: Culti Group Belgium: New in Town & Local Languages

description:
We are an international group of Sales Professionals sharing ideas and best practices on Sales innovation. Members have three platforms available within the SalesRemixed community.

Meetup Groups: Sales presentations and discussing ideas and best practices.

Linkedin: Online discussions and news on Sales innovation.

IdeaExchange: Sales tips & ideas posted and rated by the SalesRemixed community.

 

Welcome to a new Sales Reality

Current developments around Internet and Social Media provide great opportunities for Sales Professionals. The competitive landscape changes rapidly now people are connected more then ever. Speed, transparency and collaboration become increasingly important.

Customers are less influenced by a traditional 1:1 relationship with Sales. The customers’ community becomes increasingly important. How are field sales able to influence these communities? Are they able to use new technologies to better learn their customers? Proper use of these technologies and new methodologies will become a decisive factor in the sales process.

 

For Sales and non-Sales

So start remixing; learn all about the new Sales reality and share ideas and best practices on Sales Innovation with other Sales Professionals.

SalesRemixed meetup groups are being established in a growing number of cities creating an international platform. To kick-off a discussion, we usually start our Meetups with an inspiring presentation. Sometimes delivered by a local speaker and sometimes from a central location via video conference.

Both Sales and non-Sales with an interest in Sales Innovation are welcome. So join us as a member of SalesRemixed

description:
This is a social running group for anyone who would like to meet new people while being active outdoors. Fun, free and good for you. Beginners and experienced runners can join – we run year-round, several times a week. Sometimes just for short distances but usually five to ten kilometers, at a speed everyone in the group is comfortable with. If your ambitions go beyond that you can also find training partners to prepare for your first race or even a marathon.

To participate you will need at least two legs, a pair of running shoes, and you should be able to jog a few kilometers without needing medical assistance. Most frequently we meet in Woluwe Park, Bois de la Cambre, Forêt de Soignes and Cinquantenaire Park. Suggestions for other locations around Brussels or other outdoor activities are welcome. In the end, it’s all about having fun together!

description:
The Irish in Europe Association (International) AISBL-

The Irish in Europe Association (International) AISBL was established in Belgium in 2011 by Royal Decree. The main function is to help the world wide Irish Diaspora living and working in Europe and promote Irish culture.community building and micro integration through a network of Chapters in Europe. It incorporates the organisational Committee of the Saint Patrick’s Day Parade of the Nations & Regions in Brussels.

www.brussels-st-patricks-day.be

To achieve its objectives, each Chapter shall build community relations with the local social, cultural and political bodies in their areas. Membership is open to all nationalities living and working in all Chapter areas.

Its integration events include “Crossing Borders on the Terrace” , "Walkers & Talkers" “Crossing Borders on Fridays “and “Health is Wealth Seminars”,Shannon-Clare Trad Irish Sessions, Cork Jazz Festival Club of Brussels, Hibernian Social Club with business orientation. Tourist information Stands on Ireland and Belgium, Irish in Europe Memorial Lectures,Start Your Own Business, Business Mentoring and Seminars. Job Seekers advisory advice  etc.For more information on Irish in Europe Cultural & Integration Events Contact:

info@irish-in-europe.be and or patricks.day.parade@gmail.com

 

The IEAI shall implement the "Help Ireland in Europe" programme which will assist in the promotion of Irish goods and services and interstate trade in co-operation with other nationalities in Europe.

IEAI seek the provision of an orderly, user-friendly, multi-lingual information on-line service on the operation and transparency of the European Union Internal Market, and the relevant taxation and administrative documents in each of the member states of the European Union.

IEAI seek to facilitate efficient working of the Internal Market by promoting provision of specific educational and training opportunities in all regions where unemployment rates are above the European Union average. These provisions would include multi-lingual training in innovation and entrepreneurship; job skills and language-training; start your own business, trade and business expansion scheme studies; and tax compliance studies.

The 2014 year theme of the Irish in Europe Association shall be

“Using Your Brain To Benefit Communities”

 

Brussels & Etterbeek Irish in Europe Chapter shall be the first Chapter of the Irish in Europe Association (International) AISBL to be established in Belgium. The main function of this Chapter is to promote Irish culture, community building and integration in the Brussels City and Etterbeek Communes. It will also assist in the organisation of the Saint Patrick’s Day Parade of the Nations & Regions. To achieve its objectives, the Chapter shall build community relations with the local social, cultural and political bodies in the Communes. The work of the Chapter shall be conducted in English, French and Dutch. Membership is open to all nationalities living and working in all areas of Brussels Capital Region. More Chapters will be established in other Communes at a later date. Please register your interest with Brussels & Etterbeek Irish in Europe Chapter: brussels.and.etterbeek.chapter@gmail.com.

La branche « Bruxelles & Etterbeek – Irlandais en Europe » sera la première section de l’association (internationale) AISBL des Irlandais en Europe à être établie en Belgique. La fonction principale de cette section est de promouvoir la culture irlandaise et l’intégration dans la ville de Bruxelles et la commune d’Etterbeek. Elle participera aussi à l'organisation de la journée de Saint Patrick de Bruxelles des nations et des régions.Pour atteindre ses objectifs, la section établira des relations communautaires avec les organes locaux sociaux, culturels et politiques de la commune. Les langues utilisées seront l’anglais, le français et le néerlandais. L’adhésion n’est ouverte à toute personne de toute nationalité vivant ou travaillant dans la région bruxelloise. D’autres sections seront ouvertes ultérieurement dans d’autres communes. Nous vous remercions de manifester votre intérêt sur le site Brussels & Etterbeek Irish in Europe Chapter: brussels.and.etterbeek.chapter@gmail.com.

De tak « Brussel & Etterbeek – Ieren in Europa» zal de eerste sectie van de (internationale) vereniging AISBL van Ieren in Europa zijn die in België gevestigd is.De belangrijkste functie van deze sectie is de promotie van de Ierse cultuur in de stad Brussel en de gemeente Etterbeek. Zijzal ookhelpen bijde organisatie vande dag "Saint Patrick's Day Parade of the Nations & Regions - Brussel"Om zijn doelstellingen te bereiken, zal de sectie communautaire relaties tot stand brengen met de sociale, locale en politieke organen van de gemeente.De gebruikte talen zijn Engels, Frans en Nederlands.Lidmaatschap is vrij voor alle nationaliteiten die leven of werken in de Brusselse regio.Andere secties zullen later opgericht worden in andere gemeenten. Indien interessen registreert U op Brussels & Etterbeek Irish in Europe Chapter: brussels.and.etterbeek.chapter@gmail.com.

topics.name: Should the Diaspora have a Vote in Irish Elections
How best can we promote Irish Culture in Europe
Is bank  burden sharing in Ireland fair& equitable

name: Irish in Europe

description:
This is a safe environment to learn about lean startup execution techniques  based on peer exchange. 

Most startups fail not because they fail to execute and build their product, but because they fail to build a viable business around it. Startup is a temporary organization designed to search for a repeatable and scalable business model.

Customer development and lean startup help us do exactly this. Lean startup is a collection of techniques built around maximizing validated customer learning thought fast Build/Measure/Learn iteration loops.

We're a group of entrepreneurs taking lean startup and customer development techniques to practice in our startups. We're ready to talk implementation and share data from our experiments.

*The Lean Startup is a trademark and service mark owned by Eric Ries.*
name: Lean Startup Circle Brussels #leanbru

description:
A group dedicated to organising events for full and part-time single parents. We hold events both with and without children and they are intended to take into consideration the specific concerns of single parents.

  • Outings to family friendly venues, dinners at family friendly restaurants.
  • Single parent evenings that cater to needs of single parents - the need to have a break with other adults, but a recognition that you need to organise babysitting and you will be one getting up early with your children regardless! Thank you for joining and we look forward to meeting you!

description:
The Photoresk - Brussels Photography Group wishes to invite all photographers and photo enthusiasts of all walks of life and skill level to join our meet-up club. Our Brussels Photography Group aims to bring beginner, amateur, semi-pro and also professional photographers together in a friendly atmosphere to share one common interest, the love of taking pictures! There's something for everyone here that loves photography - travel, people, landscapes, close-up, you name it, there'll be a chance to discover it...

The Brussels Photography Group enables you to:

  • Learn about photography.
  • Practice and improve your photography skills and have fun shooting different themes.
  • Share information and tips on photography, post processing as well as printing.
  • Come to our walks and join our excursions.
  • Discover exciting new locations in Brussels and Belgium.
  • Meet-ups at many of Brussels awesome locations to discuss your beautiful images. Bring your USB and the organiser will bring the rest.
  • Compete in friendly contests where you can showcase your work.
  • Enjoy presentations from members and/or guest speakers.

New ideas and suggestions to improve the group are always welcome. It's a joint effort here to make the activities interesting, fun and engaging.

description:
Welcome to the delicious world of Indian food. This exotic, mulch-layered cuisine with its rich textures, flavors and aromas will always leave you longing for more.... Once you've got the basics sorted, you can confidently build on them!

Our goal is to bring a group of people together to cook and eat delicious foods and make new friends.

You can learn - Roti, naan, sheekh kebab (minced meat on iron skewers), chicken tikka (succulent chunks of chicken), butter chicken, tandoori chicken, aloo muttar (curry made with potatoes and peas), samosa, daal makhani, idlis (steamed cakes made from rice batter), or dosas or uttapams (pancakes made from a batter of rice and lentil flour). and many more...

Please make suggestions about the type of meet ups that you would like to attend or for me to create.

 

I look forward to meeting and cooking with you.
who: Learn how to cook Indian food
name: Cooking Indian Food - exotic flavors from India.

description:
Who are we?

We are the Belgium Web Performance Group. We meet monthly to discuss various topics related to Web Performance, both front-end and back-end. We are one of the local entity as you have already many in the world (San Francisco, New York, etc...)

Why is this so important?

Multiple studies have shown a direct correlation between web site performance and the bottom line:

  • +100ms → -1% sales (Amazon) *
  • +400ms → -5-9% full-page traffic (Yahoo! Autos front page) **
  • +500ms → -20% searches (Google) ***






At the same time web pages are growing at a increasing pace and getting heavier and heavier:



















This makes this topic very hot and important, especially during the economic downturn when every penny gained from higher user engagements or saved from lower hardware or bandwidth costs matter a lot.




Join our group and meet all the people who care about their sites' performance and are happy to share their knowledge, the tools, techniques, and magic tricks of web site performance optimization.

First meetings will be setup soon. Just join the group for now in order to be kept aware.
name: Belgium Web Performance Group

description:
Dear Women,

in our times of great change -this is a meet-up for us to connect: to ourselves, each other. To form a community of support.

Here's the thing: Society and culture have gotten a bit out of balance: too much focus on individual agency and too little emphasis on community and collaboration. We love the masculine but we’ve created too much of a good thing. If feminine energy, in women, in men and in society at large has been repressed, then, in part, it’s because we’ve allowed that to happen, even if only at a very unconscious level. It’s our responsibility to rise as women and to rediscover what we have to give.

As women, we're designed, through our very bodies, to literally hold space within which new life can be created. These days though, the world needs both holding and creativity on a much larger scale. Let's use our extraordinary capacities: let's collectively hold space for humanity as a whole. Leadership, in this 21st century will often be invisible.

I am offering various activities for women. To heal. To grow. To share. To inspire and support each other. To be. To celebrate.

Check out the calendar for upcoming events in October and November.

kind regards,

Katrin

description:
Do you like learning languages? Well, so do a lot of people in Brussels!
Let's have a cup of coffee or tea and practice our languages together
in a comfortable and above all safe environment.

 

 

 

 

 

 

Language Café is not for everybody.

Language Café is a a compact group of people who like helping each other with their languages.

 

 

 

 

 

This is how it works.

 

Membership Requirements

All members must meet the following requirements. If you do not comply with the following requirements, your membership application will be declined or removed.

  1. You must have a clear picture of yourself with your face clearly visible and no other people in the picture. 
    No sun glasses, big scarf, big hats, or anything that partially hides your face.
    No group pictures. 
    No black&white.
    No photos in the distance.
    No photoshopping or artistic renditions.

    These photos will be approved:









    This type of photo will be rejected:





  2. You must complete the Introduction in your Profile. 
     Tell at least three things about yourself.
     "Hi" or "I want to learn French" is not an introduction.
     For instance, tell us about your interests, where you come from,
     how long you've been in Brussels, what you do in your free time, etc.

     If you do not, your membership application will be declined or removed.
  3. You must fully answer all Profile Questions.
     If you do not, your membership application will be declined or removed.

 

By-Laws

Your membership is removed and you are banned from the Language Café if:

  • You display a behavior in public not in keeping with the purposes and principles of the Language Café.
  • You send an email to the Organizers or other members not in keeping with the purposes and principles of the Language Café.
  • You displays discrimination against or harassment of any other member because of race, color, national or ethnic origin, age, disability, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression.
  • Language Café can only operate thanks to the Organizers and Event Hosts' time and effort. The Organizers and Event Hosts organize the event, schedule the Language Tables, arrange and clean the premises before and after the event, prepare the refreshments, make sure that emails are replied to, and much more. If you behave or email statements that disrespect, abuse or harass the Organizers and/or Event Hosts, your membership will be removed and you will be banned from the Language Café.
  • Language Café can only operate if its members share their language skills by hosting a Language Table and helping other members learn their native and fluent languages. If you are not willing to share your language skills or you effectively do not do so, your membership will be removed and you will be banned from the Language Café.

If you are banned you cannot join either the Language Café and or its affiliated groups again.

 

Language Café Meetups

Language Café Meetups last approximately 2 hours.

They have 3 Sessions of 40 minutes each.

Language Tables are organized for each session, depending on the availability of our Language Table Hosts.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Language Tables

Each Language Table:

  • lasts approximately 40 minutes
  • has a Language Table Host, who is a native or fluent speaker for that language
  • has a maximum of 4 Learners

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

A Language Table Host would typically:

  • host a language table for approximately 40 minutes.
  • talk in one of his/her own native or fluent languages
  • listen to the other linguists at his/her language table
  • occasionally correct them or advise them

 

RSVP Questions

When you RSVP for a meetup you must answer the RSVP Questions so that our Language Tables can be organized in advance.

If you do not answer the RSVP Questions, you will receive a message notifying you that your RSVP is invalid and asking you to fill in the RSVP Questions.
Please notice that if you RSVP with a smart phone this may not work (not so smart after all ;)


Join In
We look forward to welcoming you to our Language Café! :)
name: Language Café

description:
Expat Club is the premier international community in Brussels. We organize social networking events and daytrips to introduce you to the best of the city, Belgium and beyond. Most of our members are in their 30's and 40's, but older and (slightly) younger people are also welcome. Meet new friends and join the community that loves the same things that you do.

Visit www.expatclub.org for all our events and register for our weekly newsletter. At the same time, make sure to visit our Meetup page and change the Emails & Notifications settings in your own profile!

Membership rules - Expat Club organises informal events. Yet, just like any other Meetup group there are some rules to observe.

1. By signing up you acknowledge being an expat or a Belgian with an international background (e.g. have lived abroad, doing a lot of international business, avid traveller, foreign spouse etc). Fake profiles or people who are not a member for the right reasons will be deleted immediately.

2. You must RSVP when you joining our events.  We have to know how many people will show up to make proper reservations.  Equally important, you must change your RSVP status if you cannot make it anymore. No-shows are a real problem for us, and we keep track of your attendance history and may delete you from our list if you are a regular no-shower.

3. Respect other members.  Further explanation is unnecessary, although you may want to know we have a (near) zero-tolerance policy.

Legal structure: Expat Club is a professional service of Xross Global Group BVBA (VAT registration number BE 0501.838.210). All paid events and trips are organised by this company and all tickets are subject to 21% Belgian VAT.

description:
Learning to Live after Loss is a Meetup group for both friends experiencing any kind of loss and grief and for those interested in learning on how to deal with loss and grief in their daily life.

We are used to think of grief only as a reaction to the death of a loved one. Grief is not just that! Any kind of loss which changes our life can cause a state of grieving. It can be a divorce, the end of a romantic relationship, the loss of a job, the loss of a pet, the end of a friendship, a move to another country, and many other life changes.

This Meetup group is not only for people who are experiencing a loss but for all those people willing to understand more about how to deal with grieving in our everyday life and learn a new approach to the grief.

We all happen to interact with friends, colleagues who are grieving and...we don't know what to say and how to behave!

This Meetup it’s not about death and sadness, it’s all about life!

It’s about learning how to live with your loss and how to continue living in your new, different life in a way that leaves room for joy and love.

“Bereavement is a universal and integral part of our experience of love” (C.S. Lewis)

Join this compassionate group of friends and give yourself permission to grieve freely, shameless, at your own pace and without judgement even the most intangible losses.

You need to learn how to live in your new life, connecting your past to your present and build your future, discovering your true self and experiencing a life with a sense of purpose and meaning!
name: Learning to Live after Loss

description:
This group is for people who value and enjoy deeper discussions with amazing people and who are also willing to rise to the occasion by joining us to help make these discussion opportunities an ongoing reality.

The events held in this group are all about having fun nights of great people and 'deeper' discussions over dinner in a charming restaurant. This Meetup group was created by Glen Brauer as part of a non-profit global initiative using practical philosophy to bring together strangers to build community. This Meetup group is now part of a network of over 6,000 members located in over 45 Meetup groups around the world. (Click here to view other locations).

 

Click here to view the upcoming topics for this year

Click here to view some pictures from previous events

 

Our events involve the following proven formula:

- open-minded individuals who are as intelligent as they are friendly

- 1 thought-provoking topic provided in advance so you have time to ponder it

- Food for Thought page provided in advance of event (click here for example)

- events are held in a charming restaurant

- restaurant is close to public transportation

- 6 people at each table (so everyone has a chance to speak)

- 1 discussion facilitator at each table (members take turns being facilitators)

- thought-provoking questions (discussion notes) are provided by Glen Brauer to the facilitators in order to stimulate the discussions.

 

The feedback from these events held around the world has been very positive. (Click here to view feedback). There are no membership fees but a small fee is required when signing up for events which goes towards Meetup costs, the time required to research and produce the discussions notes, booking restaurant reservations, scheduling the events, and coordinating the facilitators.

If this sounds interesting to you then click "Join Us" on the top-right of this screen then RSVP to events when they are posted. Members receive email notifications when new events are scheduled.

 

The Philosophy Dinners Facebook Group

The purpose of the Philosophy Dinners Facebook group is to cultivate the global citizen mindset; by enriching our perspectives through the sharing of insights before and after the events take place in our individual cities.

Click here to join the Philosophy Dinners Facebook Group

description:
Once started, this debating club will offer you both a nice platform and a supportive environment to practice and improve your persuasive skills under the motto ‘learning by doing’. You try and find out yourself what works and what not, instead of paying expensive consultants to tell you what to do!

To know more join our Facebook page:

https://www.facebook.com/BrusselsDebaters

 

-----
FAQs:
What is debating?
- Debating is not just about public speaking. If you just want to hone your presentation skills, we recommend the Toastmasters MeetUp. If you are keen to debate, take a look at our summary: https://docs.google.com/file/d/0B1evWUZPOYK0Y196RW1PYnd6Z0k/edit?pli=1

In which language do you debate, and about what?
- We debate in English and often about political topics. No previous knowledge required but it does not hurt to follow the news.

Can I join?
- We strive to be inclusive and believe diversity is enriching. Hence, we particularly encourage women, people with disabilities and people of colour to participate.
- Are you an experienced debater? Drop us an email. We are always keen to welcome competent fellows on board.


How much is it?
- The training and the debates are free of charge. We nonetheless recommend to attend regularly because the sessions build on what has been learned before.

description:
A group for the walking & outdoor enthousiasts in Brussels. Is it necessary to say more? Actually yes.

Activities

The main focus will be mostly given on one-day walks in Belgium. We will mostly follow GR-trails or other walking events that can be reached by public transportation. The trails are selected to show the best of the region they cross (nature, but also national heritage), while avoiding mass tourism areas.

RSVP'ing and no-shows

If you RSVP'd yes for a hike but cannot join please warn at least two day in advance. Persons who don't come or who RSVP'd yes, but change their mind at last minute will be put on the waiting list for the next activities. People who also join several activities and are on the main list of one will also be moved to the end of the waiting list.

Weather

Please note that activities are not automatically cancelled because of the weather, but they may be adapted. Some people do enjoy walking in forests during rain, really. You are asked to change your status if you don't want to join because of the weather. If there are not enough participants, the activity will be then cancelled/postponed.

Disclaimer

The Brussels Hiking Group is not meant to be a hiking club but to allow experienced hikers to announce their willingness to do a given hike, find people to go along with and have a nice day. You are not supposed to be an expert, but to know your limits and choose to participate or not to an activity accordingly. You have also to make sure that you are covered by an insurance policy that covers hiking before taking part to an activity, and you also know the risks inherent to hiking. The Brussels Hiking Group is also a platform to allow interested people to propose their own activities, on their personal initiative. The Brussels Hiking Group acts only in that case as an intermediary and its organisers could not be held responsible in case of accident.
name: Brussels Hiking Group

description:
The purpose of this group is to develop our skills in the verbal, numerical and abstract tests (Aptitude tests).

The activities of this group will cover common training/competitions and sharing of knowledge and best practices mainly in relation to the aptitude tests( psychometric tests).

For those who do not know the aptitude tests are the most common methods to evaluate cognitive skills of prospective employees. They are widely used by multinational companies and civil service recruiters.

Verbal reasoning tests are essentially reading comprehension tests. Numerical reasoning tests are calculation exercises based on statistical charts and graphs where you are generally required to find a certain percentage, or to decide on relative values.Abstract reasoning is similar to the IQ test and is related to the fluid intelligence and with the capacity of a person to understand the relationship between various concepts.

People interested to practice psychometric tests or to share best practices in relation to them are invited to join this group.
name: Succeeding in psychometric tests (EPSO tests)

description:
Calling marketing professionals in Brussels to stay up-to-date on the latest developments in marketing technology! 

Data-driven marketing refers to the marketing insights and subsequent decisions that arise from the analysis of data about or from consumers. Marketing with data makes an impact, accelerated by marketing automation platforms and innovative marketing technology. In marketing, an innovative, forward-thinking spirit is crucial to leverage big data, social media, web and mobile experiences. 

The DDM Alliance wants to stimulate this innovative, forward-thinking necessity by providing marketing professionals, agencies and providers (of marketing automation and innovative marketing technologies) international and local platforms to gather, interact and form partnerships throughout European marketing communities. 

The landscape of data-driven marketing will be shaped by a number of developments: 

• massive data collection across multiple touch points becomes standard

• social media grows into big data 

• permission marketing becomes the norm, and

• marketing automation & programmatic marketing ends the age of generalizations. 

For marketers, this is the opportunity of a lifetime. The emergence of the data storm, social media and the steady decline of mass media are the three biggest marketing stories of the decade. The rapid transition from mass to data dominance and social media presents the opportunity to create impactful, relevant marketing messages. This data-powered personalized marketing approach is not only much more effective, but also more cost-efficient and scalable. 

Join the DDM Alliance now and start leveraging all new possibilities now!
name: DDM Brussels (Data-Driven Marketing Alliance)

description:

Like fitness, exercise - and even have fun?

Like moving, running, jumping, shouting, laughing and crying?

Do you love your body work? To feel it, to know you have been outside in fresh air and enjoyed yourself?

Exactly!

You have come to the right place.

Playing beachvolley gives you all that. No need for fancy exquipment (like bats, clubs or rackets). A vb-ball, a net (or just a rope), a sandy surface (it could be a grassplane, too;-), a few other players, voila, and we are going.

So, you ask, where's the beach - we live in Brussel.

Well, let's call it "Urban Beachvolley" then ;-). No need for fancy beaches like the Copacabana, Strandvejen or Boulevard des Anglais ;-). And we have already identified a few places where we have a bv lane to play on.

 


Into the future :

This group is open for everybody who wants to make Brussels the new centre of continental urban beach volleyball (bv), so that at one point we will surpass even Berlin and Copenhagen ;-) We will find venues to play outside during the summer, on real beaches, and training options during the winter. Like in Copenhagen and Odense we could establish a bv-hall so we can play in real sand all year round. Let's also get some trainers of format to Brussels, so we get some headstart above other players.

Good luck and welcome,


Bernd K (chief facilitator of Urban Beachers :-)

We meet every second Saturday of the month. There's usually a theme and some kind of activity or exercise, with no required preparations - though we like it when people bring on-topic things to talk about to the meetup, like an article they've read or a question that's been bothering them.

The group mostly communicates through a mailing list: https://groups.google.com/forum/#!forum/lesswrong-brussels
Feel free to introduce yourself there, or just come over to our next meetup and see what we're like.

This also means that the membership on meetup.com does not necessarily reflect the actual group size (though we're still pretty small).

description:
WASHYOURWORLD, Global Meditation for a visible positive change.
Let's focus on LOVE.

Strange things happen on this planet.
Wars are being fought, injustice is increasing, people die from hunger, the few rule the many,
laws are getting more numerous and more inhuman, WE destroy the Earth by the way consume,
we are misled by the mainstream media in every aspects of our daily lives, ....
Who wants that? You, your neighbour, anyone you know?
NO.
So, who? Let's discover that together with the THRIVE movie and let's throw some LOVE vibrations in this non-sensical system
we call modern society.
WashYourWorld will not only speak about issues, but also about show the simplest remedy: BEING AWARE, BEING JOYFUL and let our EMOTIONS flow freely.

We will describe the problem in depht and collaborate together to find solutions:

LOVE instead of FEAR,
 CO-CREATION instead of CO-PYRIGHT, 
 UNION instead of DIVISION,
 HIGH FREQUENCIES instead of LOW VIBRATIONS,
 WAKING-UP instead of PERMANENT SLUMBER,
 TOGETHER instead of ALONE AND LOST.

Why WashYourWorld ?


If you 'wash' your inside world, your mental, (by becoming aware, by meditating, ...) your perception of the world will change.  You will feel like improving things around you.
You will take simple actions and your surroundings will get more agreable.
It might be as simple as picking up a garbage piece in the street and putting it in the trash, smiling to a person, helping someone out of unconditional love, tidying up your place, throwing away material things you don't need, ...

And it also works the other way around: if you begin to 'wash' the outside world, the projected reality that you are experimenting, then as it becomes more agreable to your senses, you will feel more calm, less stressed, and your awareness will also increase.

It's a positive loop, that feeds itself and is exponential.
 LOVE is the highest vibration and is the fabric of the Universe.
Some call it God, Prime Creator, Allah, Jesus, ...
We are all this infinite awareness exprimenting within itself and we are all centers of the Universe.

Let's celebrate our uniqueness and our differences instead of scorning them.

Together, let's change the world :)

<3
name: WashYourWorld, Global Meditation

description:
Meet other developers and ops engineers using Docker. Docker is an open platform for developers and sysadmins to build, ship, and run distributed applications. Consisting of Docker Engine, a portable, lightweight runtime and packaging tool, and Docker Hub, a cloud service for sharing applications and automating workflows, Docker enables apps to be quickly assembled from components and eliminates the friction between development, QA, and production environments. As a result, IT can ship faster and run the same app, unchanged, on laptops, data center VMs, and any cloud.

Learn more about Docker at http://www.docker.com

“MistaPeo * is”, is de reis van de hoog gevoelige vrouw en het kind doorheen de kamers van hun ziel naar het oneindige veld van hun innerlijke roeping. De geliefde pioniersvrouw en -kind die ze zijn. De taal die ze daar leren, krijgt gestalte in het vrijgeven van wat hen weerhoudt van de essentie, het unieke creatuur dat ze zijn.

Vanuit dit grensverleggende perspectief worden zij de makers van hun leven waar ze iedere droom manifesteren in de realiteit van hun sociale en professionele leven.

Hildegarde Follon, bezielster van “MistaPeo*is” nodigt je uit om op reis te gaan naar je ware zelf.

” Beweeg doorheen het spectrum van het innerlijke kind dat zichzelf ontdekt in de onvoorwaardelijke liefde die de taal van het hart spreekt. Laat je verbeelding geprikkeld worden met de gave in het moment dat jij bent. “

Bezoek www.mistapeois.com voor meer info

description:
What is TechMeetups?


TechMeetups has been setup to create a global network of Tech communities from San Francisco to Sydney. We believe that Tech communities are isolated and great things can be achieved if we connect within our cities and outside our borders. Our goal is to create a global Tech cluster of over 50 inter-connected Tech communities by 2015.

Our global community started out with the launch of the London Silicon Roundabout Tech community in December 2010. Following it's success in becoming one of the city's fastest growing groups, we have launched TechMeetups communities in the following locations:

Europe: London, Berlin, Cambridge, Lisbon, Moscow, Manchester, Paris, Budapest, Belgrade, Amsterdam, Stockholm, Dublin, Munich, Edinburgh, Hamburg, Vienna & Barcelona

USA: New York, Dallas, Miami & San Francisco

Asia: Bangalore, Bangkok, Mumbai & Singapore

Others : Dubai, Sydney, Rio De Janeiro & Sao Paulo


You can see our latest list of communities here.


• Why become a member of TechMeetups?

Anyone who is thinking about starting their own software or web company and wants to bounce ideas off each other and meet potential partners or investors are welcome to join this group!

Our aim is to connect the various tech communities to help our members network, connect, invest and launch products in the hottest technology clusters. We plan to organise monthly meetups to cover various technology subjects that are of interest to our members.


• GET INVOLVED IN EVENTS WORLDWIDE on TechMeetups!

Check out all upcoming events in all our communities and promote your company in one of them!

SPONSOR| PRESENT| MENTOR



• STARTUP NEWS AND ARTICLES TechStartHub!

We compile the best Startup News & Articles from around the globe.





• POST YOUR STARTUP JOBS at TechStartupJobs!

Recruiting ? Wanting to hire that perfect team? Post your jobs on TechStartupJobs and/or take part in TechStartupJobs Fair to attract the right talent to your company.





• FUND YOUR STARTUP AT TechStartupFund!

Looking for Seed Funding to launch your Startup? Don’t want to give away any Equity ? Launch your Startup on TechStartupFund and lets get the community behind you.
name: Brussels TechMeetups

The focus and goal of the group is to train our attention and to focus on the present.

description:
FULL info is now in the F.A.Q. :

http://www.meetup.com/BruSsels-FuNky-FreNch-imPROVe-with-imPROV/messages/boards/thread/42005412

BruSsels FuNky FreNch:
           imPROVe with theater and musical imPROV 

*Funny theater improv games, funky musical improvisation: 100% In French!
*No theater or singing experience needed
*Just come with your wish to improve your French, in a fun and fast way
*Participation is possible from a decent beginners level on
*Take your French out of your comfort zone!


Did you know that...

..improv is where you can laugh about all those endless French mistakes

..it's the best way to get over whatever fear of speaking there may be

..this leads you to becoming a self-confident public speaker, even in French!

..singing gives you powerful ankers for your French structures & pronunciation

..singer or no singer, songs are an amazing tool to connect with French speakers

..singing and improv games are a great work-out for your voice!


Workshop description:

- Theater improv basics:

         Letting go, Accepting, Voice, Imagination, Ecoute (L.a. V.i.e.!)

- Funny games:

         co-construction, creativity, fun!

- Singing improv basics:

         rhythm, breath, grounding, tone, harmony

- Funky songs:

        French hits, from all times & styles

       (accompanied or acapella: 2 or 3 harmony voices) 


All explanation, exercises, games & songs will be 100% in French.

Materials provided (copies, vocab hand-outs, mp3's)

description:
The Brussels Data Science Community, is the Belgian voice for data scientists with a conscience.  If you have a desire to stay at the forefront of technological innovation & positive social change, join us.  

We use data in the service of humanity .

Once a month this community of #DataWranglers #Philanthrogeeks #CyberAnthropologists #AwesomeNerds #DataMungers #Datawhisperers #Probabilists & #BigData professionals gathers in Brussels to talk about how to drive measurable value from data and to convert data to €. 

Each month private or public companies will confront the community with one specific problem it is facing in the hope that the group can draft different paths to a solution.

It's a venue for sharing, discussing, showcasing and developing ideas for how data sciences should be used. 

We want to:

•  be a knowledge hub for data scientists, we are open to everybody. 
• Share knowledge - work on practical business cases - learn from others - have fun are some of our driving forces.

Our GOAL: 

"Our ultimate goal is to make the difference by applying our science and knowledge on social challenges."

Our members are looking for opportunities to contribute their professional skills to make a positive impact on our local community or  in the world. 

Sign up for our meetings on www.meetup.com/Brussels-Data-Science-Meetup/
Follow our community on Twitter: @DataScienceBe
Check out the job postings on our Linkedin group: http://goo.gl/jJMYQP
Follow Google+ community: http://goo.gl/ySWvhj
We have 1 follower on our facebook page !  https://www.facebook.com/Datasciencebe


We are looking forward to meeting you soon !

The Brussels Data Science Community

----------------------------------------------------------------

Who should attend:

• Business and public industry leaders  who leverage data to compete and win

• Enterprise architects, IT, data warehousing, and business intelligence professionals

• Hadoop developers, data scientists, business analysts, statisticians and hackers
name: Brussels Data Science Meetup

description: Brussels and its hinterland don't really have an accessible cycling scene. There are some cycling clubs and several informal group rides but it's not always easy to integrate. With its main focus on the road (at least initially), this virtual cycling club is about sharing our love for the sport on and off the bike with regular rides and visits to races in Belgium and beyond.

description: Mindfulness in motion is about bringing you into better contact with yourself, your body, your own presence and with your spirit. It can lead to heighten states of awareness, help you express emotions and feelings that you often try to inhibit, and it can help you integrate things that are going on in your everyday life. Using structured exercises that have been tried and tested by thousands of people around the globe we will experience our very own mindfulness in motion. This group meets regularly once a month on Sunday mornings with dynamic meditations and there will be longer workshops offered on an occasional basis. This group is for you if you answer ‘YES’ to any of the following questions: Do you have a really quick mind, always thinking about lots of things, and you’d like to find that place of calm and stillness that other people seem to have? Do you want to have better contact with your body and your feelings? Would you like to give your body full freedom of expression, and explore how it can change, moment to moment? Would you like to des-stress and recharge your batteries? Would you like to feel a greater sense of vibrant aliveness throughout your day?
name: Brussels Mindfulness in Motion

description:
E.G.G., the English-speaking Gay Group, was started in 1986, as a way to make new acquaintances and to have a drink and pleasant conversation with friends in a relaxed and very casual atmosphere - without having to shout over eardrum-blasting music.

The group has a party each month on a Sunday afternoon from 3.30 to 7.00 for GLBTs and welcomes men and women of all nationalities and age groups. We take over a restaurant or a hotel banquet room for our parties and are thus assured of complete privacy. We ask 3 euros participation - for the cost of mailings and the like - at each party one attends. There is no membership fee. Drinks are on a "cash bar" basis.

Announcements are sent out ten to fourteen days before, giving the date and place. Our parties have been running between 20 and 30 or more people recently.

Info: tomhoemig@skynet or 02 537 47 04.

We hope to welcome you soon.

I will regularly organise workshops to develop intuition, one-week spiritual retreats with fun workshops, meditation classes, nature walks with meditation and also simple get-togethers to discuss spirituality and related themes, to exchange spiritual practices and to have a drink and a laugh together while doing so. 

Ceci est un groupe pour les personnes qui sont sur une voie d'évolution spirituel ou qui sont curieux par rapport à la spiritualité, la méditation et leurs capacités intuitives. J'organiserai régulièrement des ateliers autour du développement de l'intuition, des retraites spirituels d'une semaine avec des ateliers rigolos, des cours de méditation, des ballades dans la nature avec de la méditation et aussi des occasions où on peut se rencontrer pour discuter de la spiritualité ou des thèmes relatés, pour échanger les pratiques spirituels autour d'un verre dans une atmosphère détendue.

description: Hello, What’s the one question you’d love to have the answer to in order to take the next step in your life ? Maybe you don’t know how to create or launch a product, leave a job, talk to your boss, deal with the stress, find a mentor, or choose the right task management tool. Whatever it is, anything is fair game. When We Surround Ourselves with Passionate, Inspiring & Inspired People, Everything Becomes Possible... Let’s support each other in making real progress toward finding and doing work we love and making a difference in the world. And have fun!

description:
The recruitment process is a matchmaking exercise where interpersonal skills play a key role. 80 % of jobs are actually found through the personal relationships you create with the potential employer. InternsGoPro offers a 5-hour training to master the job hunt and develop your interpersonal skills.

Our trainings combine teaching best practices with very specific exercises to apply what you have learned. We will simulate job situations using improvisational theatre techniques, and challenge you on sticking points of the job hunt – the first impression, answering hard questions, asking good questions, conveying one’s value, etc. You will receive feedback on your behaviour, experiment with alternatives and gain more confidence in dealing with typical situations on a job hunt.
name: Brussels Job Hunt Meetup

description: Attention to all frustrated songwriters euh ... in there ... Let's start a community to blast away the mental roadblocks and tap into our deepest creative resources! The idea comes from the incredible "The frustrated songwriter's handbook" (Backbeat books). Ultimate goal is to play the "20 song game" by sharing 20 songs composed by each one of us in 1 day. Sounds fun no?
name: Kortenberg Frustrated Songwriters Lodge

description:
Dan Hunter is a Brussels-based company. Behind the company there is an ex-athlete and experienced coach, Dan Hunter, who has put together a unique method of fitness combining exercises and nutrition in a way that goes far beyond the traditional sports & nutrition packages already existing.

The DAN HUNTER Method aims at helping you reach your optimal health and performance long-term by solid nutrition and fitness protocols. Our unique holistic, full-body approach focuses on concrete results and is designed for a lifetime transformation and long-term benefits.

The DAN HUNTER Method is based on on-going studies and experiences from the USA, Canada, the UK and Continental Europe.

Together with his international team of coaches, Dan Hunter offers a series of services that aim at helping people reach a healthy life style and long-term wellbeing.

What do we do? Among many other health & fitness related services, we organise Bootcamps in parks in and around Brussels*

Outdoor group trainings including exercises ranging from fat burning cardio to core work and strength exercises, balancing form, endurance and intensity, adapted to any level of fitness with a true personalised focus. Coupled with the bootcamp is a custom-designed nutritional guidance programme with a personal thorough follow-up (meetings, start-mid-end-measurements, online assistance,…)

* Bois de La Cmabre, Tervuren Park, Cinquantenaire Park, Waterloo,…

For more information: www.danhunter.be
name: Dan Hunter Bootcamp in parks in & around Brussels

description: Communauté interactive constituée des métiers de la création de contenu web : rédacteurs web, producteurs audiovisuels, illustrateurs, content marketers, etc. Échanges d'informations à valeur ajoutée, débats d'idée, organisation de networkings centrés sur la communauté. Interactive community of web content creation professionals: web editors, audiovisual producers, illustrators, content marketers, etc. Here we exchange value added information, we debate ideas, we organise community centred networking.
name: Web Content Creators [Belgium]

description:
(EN) Le Salon Brussels is a social network for discussion of science, art, politics, philosophy and literature, with the aim of learning, sharing ideas, socializing and having fun. Think of it as a virtual space inspired by the French literary salons of the 17th to 19th century, infused with some of the democratic and progressive spirit of Bohemian coffeehouse culture. Events may take the form of speaker meetings, discussion circles, cultural outings or social get-togethers: the kind of thing your alumni organization may organize perhaps, but open to the whole community and taking place right here in town. If you always wondered what it would be like to host your own salon, welcome on board : your ideas and enthusiasm will be very welcome. We will host events in English and French as well as other languages to the extent there is interest.

(FR) Le Salon Brussels est un réseau social pour discuter de la science, de l'art, de la politique, de la philosophie et de la littérature, afin d'apprendre, de partager les idées, de faire des rencontres et de s'amuser. il s'agit d'un espace virtuel inspiré des salons littéraires francais, pimenté de l'esprit progressiste et démocratique des cafés de la Boheme. On discute, on écoute des conférences, on se rencontre: un peu comme autrefois avec vos camarades de l'unif mais alors tous azimuts. Et si vous vous imaginez comme salonniere, bienvenue: vos idées et votre enthousiasme seront précieux. Nos evenement ont lieu en anglais ou francais en fonction du groupe et de l'intervenant eventuel.
name: Le Salon Brussels

description: This meetup is there to meet and share experience with other artisans, artists, makers, hobbyist, entrepreneurs, engineers, wood and metal workers, designers... around one question: how to make things? It is dedicated to fabrication in general with a sweet spot for digital fabrication (3d printing, CNC, laser cutting, ...). Everyone is welcome! We can discuss, share, brag and ask for advices, techniques and realizations.

We will organize monthly degustations, wine tutorials, check out wine bars weekly, invite you to wine events and fairs in town (and abroad!) and share our passion for wine with you. Join us for a glass! Cheers!

This network is dedicated to creating a community around Health 2.0 in Brussels and Ghent as part of the international Health 2.0 movement. It's a venue for sharing, discussing, showcasing and developing ideas for how to improve patient care. If you are interested in the intersection of health care and information technology, this is a group for you. Technology enthusiasts, developers, students, physicians, nurses, pharmacists, patients, designers, social workers are welcome.

This initiation to wine-tasting is part of a full wine event, given that same evening, so after the wine-tasting, you are all invited to share a glass of wine upstairs and enjoy a nice social time!
name: Wine tasting : Discover - Enjoy - Share!

description:
English:

Belgium has a rich tradition in wind bands. Despite, Brussels counts very few of them. This group is meant to gather musicians who are willing to play in a new wind band in Brussels, starting as soon as possible. The goal of the band is to hold regular rehearsals in order to perform some stage and/or marching concerts.

Do you play a wind band instrument? You are already playing in a band and you want something more? Or maybe you have played an instrument when you were younger and now you are eager to start playing again? Why not joining the group and start playing with the band as soon as we have enough members?

Whether you have always lived in Brussels, you have been expatriated to Brussels, you are studying in Brussels, or you are working in Brussels and going home afterwards: just join the group so we can get in touch! We are looking for anyone able to express him/herself in English, French or Dutch.

You don't play an instrument yourself, but you know people who do? Inform them about this opportunity. They will be grateful!

Are you available to help organizing the band? Please indicate so when joining, so we can gather to get this band running.

Meanwhile? Just start dreaming! You could soon be playing in a band like this one: (http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=o9_bjats2x4 )


Nederlands:

België heeft een rijke traditie aan harmonieorkesten. Desondanks kent Brussel er slechts weinig. Deze groep heeft als doel het verzamelen van muzikanten die wensen te spelen in een nieuw harmonieorkest in Brussel, dat zo vroeg mogelijk wenst te starten. Het doel van de harmonie is om regelmatige repetities te houden om zo tot het geven van podium- en straatconcerten over te kunnen gaan.

Speelt u een instrument? U speelt reeds in een groep/orkest en je wenst meer? Of misschien heb je een instrument bespeeld toen je jonger was en nu wens je opnieuw te beginnen? Waarom niet lid worden van deze groep om bij deze harmonie te spelen vanaf we genoeg leden hebben?

Of u nu altijd in Brussel gewoond hebt, je voor het werk naar Brussel werd overgeplaatst, je studeert in Brussel, of werkt in Brussel om iedere avond naar huis terug te keren: wordt lid van deze groep zodat we contact met je kunnen opnemen! We zijn op zoek naar iedereen die zich kan uitdrukken in het Nederlands, Engels of het Frans.

U speelt zelf geen instrument, maar u kent mensen die dat wel doen? Informeer hen over dit initiatief. Ze zullen u dankbaar zijn!

Bent u beschikbaar om het harmonieorkest te helpen organiseren? Gelieve dit aan de duiden wanneer u lid wordt van de groep, zodat we kunnen afspreken om deze harmonie op te starten.

En ondertussen? Begin maar alvast te dromen! U zou binnenkort in een harmonie als deze kunnen spelen: (http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=o9_bjats2x4 )

Français:

La Belgique a une tradition riche quant aux fanfares et des harmonies. Néanmoins, Bruxelles n’en compte que très peu. Ce groupe a comme but de réunir les musiciens qui aimeraient jouer dans une harmonie Bruxelloise, à commencer le plus tôt que possible.

Vous jouez un instrument ? Vous jouez déjà dans une fanfare/harmonie et vous voulez plus ? Ou peut-être que vous avez joué un instrument quand vous étiez plus jeune et maintenant vous voulez recommencer? Pourquoi ne pas joindre ce groupe et commencer à jouer dans cette harmonie à partir du moment qu’on a assez de membres ?

Si vous avez toujours vécu à Bruxelles, ou si vous avez été expatrié à Bruxelles pour le boulot, ou si vous faites vos études à Bruxelles, ou si vous travaillez à Bruxelles pour retourner chaque soir chez vous : joignez ce groupe pour que nous puissions se mettre en contact ! Nous cherchons tout le monde qui peut s’exprimer en Français, Anglais ou en Néerlandais.

Vous ne jouez pas un instrument vous-mêmes, mais vous connaissez des gens qui le font ? Informez-les de cette opportunité. Ils vous seront reconnaissant !

Vous êtes disponible pour aider avec l’organisation de l’harmonie ? Svp indiquez-le quand vous joignez ce groupe, afin de pouvoir organiser cette harmonie.

Et entretemps? Commencez à rêver! Vous pouvez jouer dans une harmonie comme celle-ci très bientôt : (http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=o9_bjats2x4 )

description:
POLICY-CHANGE: €0.50; from now on I will charge everybody who comes along 50 cents once per year to cover the cost that Meetup charges me. Feel free to unsubscribe if you think I only do this to get rich quick ;-).

I am also not using the +1 option anymore; if you want friends to come along, they can become Meetup members (as you know this is free). I have had too many bad experiences with careless people and their friends.

No-shows: I expect everybody who RSVP's to come along to show a minimum of involvment and interest. I mean by this: CHECK the site regularly for updates to the activity, as an organiser I can see when this does not happen, and I reserve the right to remove you from the active list if I suspect you will not show up and you do not reply to messages I send you.

If you do actually not show up and fail completely to explain yourself to me either through a phonecall or mail I will ban you from my section of the site and report you to Meetup.

On the day of the activity you cannot reach me anymore through the site (I do not own a smartphone), I always share my phone number so THIS is the way to contact me. The group cannot wait for people who are late in the morning when we are dependent on public transport.

In this group I'm trying to get together likeminded people who want to enjoy the outdoors at a leisurely pace. Objective is to go walking or cycling, mainly half- (late fall/winter when it gets dark early) or one-day-events on weekends, but weekdays are possible too when they are on holidays.

Here and there I might smuggle in a little culture, like a museum or a local landmark.

For walking I'm thinking of keeping it at a distance of around 20 km, I don't believe in doing distances just for the sake of doing long  distances and then in the end having to run for the last train, I go out of my front door to have fun, not to prove anything to myself or anyone else. If you want to do 40 km or more there are other groups (and treadmills) you can use.

I have a certain pace (3-4 km/h while walking) which I think is not exaggerated. If you want to walk faster than this, I suggest you find another group; I will NEVER speed up for you from my comfortable pace, you might end up waiting at every corner or taking a very late train back because you thought you could find the way all by yourself and we lost sight of each other. I do not go back and search for anyone, but I will slow down for people who have difficulties towards the end of the walk, I don't leave people behind who have misjudged themselves a little bit.

Cycling could be up to 100 km (mainly flat terrain like canals and old railway lines in Flanders and Wallonia). I do not own a racing bike nor do I drive at racing speeds...The objective is to have fun and meet friendly people from all walks of life. I am based in Mechelen but make use of the relatively good public transport system to go all over the place, I have access to a car as well so carsharing may be an option. Input of others is encouraged and appreciated!

When mapping out longer tracks I'll also TRY to include short-cuts (railway/bus stations along the way) for people who would like to have options, of course this is not always possible and I will not cut the walk short for myself and people who will do the full walk; a smartphone with GPS is a handy instrument if you are unsure you can finish the complete activity, as is a printed version (zoomed in enough) of the Routeyou-map I will always provide.


I'd also like to add that I don't mean to have this be a family-oriented thing, at least the trips I do myself. Couples and friends who already know one another are more than welcome to come along on activities but no kids please, anyone can use my account though to plan their own activities...

A few links to get people started on their own trips:

Cycling-network in Flanders,Holland and small part of Wallonia: http://fietsnet.be/routeplanner...­

Cycling on the RAVEL (wallonia): http://ravel.wallonie.be/opencm...­ (I know I know it's only in French, blame them not me :-p)

Free BASECAMP map program from GARMIN
http://www8.garmin.com/support/...­

Free BENELUX topographic map to use in BASECAMP (this is a volunteers' project and sometimes automatic routing doesn't work properly)
http://www.openfietsmap.nl/down...­

Walking networks in Flanders (except Limburg, they would not co-operate...): http://www.wandelknooppunt.be/­

ROUTEYOU: also lets you build all kinds of routes on different map styles online for free

www.routeyou.com
name: Belgian walking and cycling daytrips

RESIDENCY

description: Invitation: To all the women out there who love to meet new women, empower each other and share tips & tricks about “how to be an amazing powerful women” and everything that surrounds this. Women’s empowerment is the most important thing these days. Women are the ones with the really great, creative and innovative ideas! Unfortunately they are almost never implemented because we hit fear, resistance, self-doubt, start to overthink and don’t take any action at all. We miss sometimes the “balls” in our live, I could say. Now it’s our time to create! Instead of competing against each other, lets cooperate and support each other. Just sign up for this empowering meetup! When? Thursday 29th of May Where? TBD, depending on the weather but probably my place What? • I want to share to you some best practices that empower me in my life • I would love to talk about all your best practices to get empowered: o How do you go for that dream? o Any advice on leading a healthy life? o Energetic Food? o Grandmother tips for the perfect skin? o …… You see, the sky in the limit! There are no rules, no right or wrong, just spending some time together to connect and to empower each other in the daily things of life. We can discuss about relationships, spirituality , careers, health,…. I want to end this meetup with a nice food sharing. I propose that you all bring a little dish, some foods that you really love, that give you the energy and vitality to nurture your body. In that way can cocreate this amazing meal and learn some amazing recipes from each other. (Don’t worry if you don’t feel like a chef cook, anything you want to bring is totally ok! & oven & fridge are at your disposal if needed) Wear some comfortable clothes, just the way you feel like (don’t worry about fashion styles, just be yourself and wear what you want! Even pajamas are permitted ;)), bring a mat or a towel (don’t worry I am not going to give you a boot camp sessions, just an introduction in my workout routines) See you next Thursday! Looking forward to meet you amazing women!

description:
At Serve the City we mobilise volunteers to show kindness in practical ways. Serve the City began in Brussels in 2004 - it is now active on three continents and in over 100 cities. At Serve the City we see ourselves as matchmakers. We are the connection between the good intentions of people who are able to serve and a meaningful opportunity to do so. We make contact with associations already active in a city; locals run most of these organizations. Together, we harness the power of our volunteer community, people from all backgrounds and nationalities, to serve those often overlooked by society. We serve six key groups – these are our main focus.
• The homeless • Asylum-seekers • The disabled • The elderly • Children in need
• Victims of abuse We use this Meetup tool to communicate our Big Volunteer Events and social gatherings. If you are interested in being more involved, please do contact us by email chalks@servethecity.net. We also have people that join us as interns, communication experts, project leaders/managers, commnity officers, funding experts, admin, marketing and PR, designers and people that just love to cook.
